home.hero_text: Unraveling viral secrets through RNA biology
home.sub_text: Luna Lab for RNA Systems Virology
home.intro: The Luna Lab is a team of molecular biologists and virologists dedicated to understanding how RNA-binding proteins orchestrate cellular responses during viral infections. We use RNA viruses as tools to uncover fundamental principles of RNA biology and develop potential therapeutic strategies for viral diseases, RNA-related disorders, and more. Current work focuses on mapping the dynamic spatial interactions between viral genomes and host factors, decoding the regulatory logic of RNA-protein networks, and developing novel tools to study RNA biology at unprecedented spatial and temporal resolution.
